topic.title: Create and Populate a Bucket
topic.shortdesc: To perform application access-testing, start by creating a new bucket and populating it with documents.

section.title: Access the Buckets View
section.p: Access the Couchbase Web Console, and left-click on Buckets, in the left-hand navigation bar. This brings up the Buckets view, which shows your currently defined buckets:
To create a new bucket, left-click on the Add Bucket button, which is located at the upper right:
This brings up the + Add Data Bucket dialog:

Specify the bucket's Name as composers. Leave the Memory Quota figure as the suggested default. Also, leave the Bucket Type as the default, Couchbase. Then, left-click on the Add Bucket button, at the lower right. The Buckets view now shows the new bucket you have created:
Left-click on the Documents tab, at the right of the composers row. This displays details of the bucket: specifically, that it is empty.

section.title: Create Documents in the New Bucket
section.p: Left-click on the Create Document button. The Create Document dialog now appears:
Specify the name composer01, for the document you will create:
Left-click on the Save Document button. This brings up the Documents Editing view, in which you can define a document:
Type a document into the edit pane, located at the upper left, exactly as follows:
Then, left-click on the Save button. This saves the document within the bucket. The message Document saved successfully! is briefly displayed.
Create two further documents, in the same way; naming them composer01 and composer02. The contents are as follows:
When you have saved both documents, return to the overall Document view. The appearance is now as follows:
This concludes creation of bucket and documents.

section.title: Next
section.p: Now that you have created a bucket, you can create users and assign roles to them; thereby controlling the access each has to the bucket and its data. Proceed to Create Users and Assign Roles.
